title: QEMU SLiRP Networking Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of QEMU. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target guest system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of SLiRP networking. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a read past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to execute code in the context of the hypervisor.
addtionnal_details: QEMU has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2020-10756
timeline:
2020-04-22 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2020-08-17 - Coordinated public release of advisory
credit: ziming zhang from Codesafe Team of Legendsec at Qi'anxin Group
